body_html:
Docker seems like a good option, though I don't have root/sudo access on my current machine, so it's harder to install.

I did just solve the import error undefined symbol: clock_gettime error, by adding -lrt to the build like this:

--- a/tensorflow/tensorflow.bzl
+++ b/tensorflow/tensorflow.bzl
@@ -284,7 +284,7 @@ _py_wrap_cc = rule(attrs={

 def tf_extension_linkopts():
-  return []  # No extension link opts
+  return ["-lrt"]

--- a/tensorflow/tensorflow.bzl

body:
Docker seems like a good option, though I don't have root/sudo access on my current machine, so it's harder to install.

I did just solve the import error `undefined symbol: clock_gettime` error, by adding -lrt to the build like this:

```
--- a/tensorflow/tensorflow.bzl
+++ b/tensorflow/tensorflow.bzl
@@ -284,7 +284,7 @@ _py_wrap_cc = rule(attrs={

 def tf_extension_linkopts():
-  return []  # No extension link opts
+  return ["-lrt"]
```
